marital_status.citation: Conversation context referring to Jennifer as wife/partner and joint planning

risk_profile_timeline.citation: ADVISOR/CLIENT1: discussion of risk score '5' and advisor classing as 3/5 moderate for retirement [01:01:56] & [01:03:07]

objectives_timeline.value: Generate approximately $12,000 per year private retirement income for Jerome (in addition to ~$12,000 Social Security) with 50% survivor benefit to Jennifer if using annuity; evaluate annuity vs systematic withdrawals and tax efficiency.

Ensure joint retirement lifestyle on about $36,000/year combined (two Social Securities at ~$12k each plus ~$12k private income), with low essential expenses (~$8k/yr) and ability to travel, especially to Sarasota condo and other trips.

Fund first 15–18 months post‑retirement before Social Security starts using after‑tax lump sums (Prudential annuity cash, Jennifer 401(k) cash out, inheritance savings) while preserving tax efficiency.
Provide 50% continuing annuity income to Jennifer on Jerome’s death if annuity route chosen; otherwise ensure IRA and other pots pass to Jennifer.

Get second opinion compared with existing advisor, to feel confident final decision isn’t leaving ‘thousands on the table’, even if outcome is similar; wants clarity on Prudential annuity rate and best combination of annuity vs withdrawals.

current_state_of_health.citation: No explicit health discussion for Jennifer

objectives_timeline.value: Have own Social Security of about $12,000/year plus access to small 401(k) (~$10k) to live on between retirement and Social Security claim date.
Retire at same time as Jerome, spend extended periods at Sarasota condo, continue some social interaction (possibly part‑time/voluntary work), maintain modest spending habits.
